tablr

Class TableRowsHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • tablr.TableRowsHandler

  • public class TableRowsHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Responsibility:
    provide a controller for the table rows mode and its use cases.
    Invariant:
    the handler always has a TableManager.
        getTableManager() != null

    • Constructor Detail

      • TableRowsHandler

        @Raw
TableRowsHandler(TableManager mng)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a tableRowHandler with the given tableManager.
        Parameters:
        mng - the tableManager this handler is created for.
        Postcondition:
        the tableManager for this is set to mng.
            if(canHaveAsTableManager(mng){getTableManager() == mng}
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if mng is invalid. | !canHaveAsTableManager(mng)

    • Method Detail

      • getOpenTable

        public java.lang.String getOpenTable()
        Returns the name of the current open table or null if there is no open table.

      • getCellValue

        public java.lang.String getCellValue(java.lang.String columnName,
                                     int row)
                              throws IllegalColumnException,
                                     IllegalRowException,
                                     IllegalTableException
        Return the cell at the given row of the column with the given column name.
        Parameters:
        columnName - The name of the column of which the cell must be returned.
        row - The row number of the row of the cell that must be returned.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        IllegalColumnException - There isn't a column with the given columnName in this table. | !getTableManager().getCurrentTable().isAlreadyUsedColumnName(columnName)
        IllegalRowException - The row doesn't exists. | row > getTableManager().getNbRows() || row < 1
        IllegalTableException - If there is no open table. | getOpenTable() == null

      • getColumnNames

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getColumnNames()
                                                     throws IllegalTableException
        Returns a new list of strings with all the names of the columns in it.
        Returns:
        List of all the column names of all the columns in this table.
        Throws:
        IllegalTableException - if there is no open table | getOpenTable() == null

      • getNbRows

        public int getNbRows()
              throws IllegalTableException
        Returns the number of rows.
        Returns:
        0 if there are no columns in this table.
            if (getTableManager().getCurrentTable().getNbColumns() == 0)
              result == 0           Otherwise, the number of values (rows) of the first column of this table.
            else
              result == getTableManager().getCurrentTable().getColumnAt(1).getNbValues()
        Throws:
        IllegalTableException - if there is no open table | getOpenTable() == null

      • getColumnType

        public java.lang.String getColumnType(java.lang.String columnName)
                               throws IllegalColumnException,
                                      IllegalTableException
        Returns the type of the column in this table with the given column name.
        Parameters:
        columnName - The name of the column of which the type should be returned.
        Returns:
        The type of the given column.
        Throws:
        IllegalColumnException - There is no column in this table with the given column name. | !getTableManager().getTableManager().getCurrentTable().isAlreadyUsedColumnName(columnName)
        IllegalTableException - If there is no open table. | getOpenTable() == null.

      • canHaveAsCellValue

        public boolean canHaveAsCellValue(java.lang.String columnName,
                                  int row,
                                  java.lang.String value)
                           throws IllegalColumnException,
                                  IllegalRowException,
                                  IllegalTableException
        Checks whether the given value can be the value for the cell of the given column (given column name) at the given row.
        Parameters:
        columnName - The name of the column.
        row - The row number of the row.
        value - The value to be checked.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        IllegalColumnException - There isn't a column with the given columnName in this table. | !getTableManager().getCurrentTable().isAlreadyUsedColumnName(columnName)
        IllegalRowException - The row doesn't exists. | row > getTableManager().getCurrentTable().getNbRows() || row < 1
        IllegalTableException - if there is no open table | getOpenTable() == null

      • setCellValue

        public void setCellValue(java.lang.String columnName,
                         int row,
                         java.lang.String value)
                  throws IllegalColumnException,
                         IllegalRowException,
                         java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                         IllegalTableException
        Sets the given value as value for the cell of the given column (given column name) at the given row.
        Parameters:
        columnName - The name of the column.
        row - The row number of the row.
        value - The value to be set.
        Effect:
        The value of the cell of the given column at the given row, is set to the given value.
            getTableManager().getCurrentTable().getColumn(columnName).setValueAt(row, value)
        Throws:
        IllegalColumnException - There isn't a column with the given columnName in this table. | !getTableManager().getCurrentTable().isAlreadyUsedColumnName(columnName)
        IllegalRowException - The row doesn't exists. | row > getTableManager().getCurrentTable().getNbRows() || row < 1
        IllegalTableException - if there is no open table | getOpenTable() == null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • addRow

        public void addRow()
            throws IllegalTableException
        Adds a row at the end of this table.
        Effect:
        For each column in this table, a new row is added at the end of the column.
            for each I in 1..getTableManager().getCurrentTable().getNbColumns():
              getTableManager().getCurrentTable().getColumnAt(I).addValue();
        Throws:
        IllegalTableException - if there is no open table | getOpenTable() == null

      • removeRow

        public void removeRow(int row)
               throws IllegalRowException,
                      IllegalTableException
        Remove the given row of this table.
        Parameters:
        row - The row to be deleted.
        Effect:
        For each column in this table, the given row is removed from the column.
            for each I in 1..getTableManager().getCurrentTable().getNbColumns():
              getTableManager().getCurrentTable().getColumnAt(I).removeValue(row);
        Throws:
        IllegalRowException - The row doesn't exists. | row > getTableManager().getCurrentTable().getNbRows() || row < 1
        IllegalTableException - if there is no open table | getOpenTable() == null

      • getTableManager

        @Basic
 @Immutable
 @Model
private TableManager getTableManager()
        Returns the tableManager.

      • canHaveAsTableManager

        @Model
private boolean canHaveAsTableManager(TableManager tableManager)
        Returns whether the given tableManager is valid as tablemanager.
        Parameters:
        tableManager - the tableManager to evaluate.
        Returns:
        true if tableManager is not null.

      • isTerminated

        public boolean isTerminated()
        Returns whether this is terminated.
